data.title: GG22 OSS - Developer Tooling and Libraries

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
Provide a brief overview of your tool, library, or framework. What specific problem or inefficiency in the development process does it address?
questions.explanation:
The Variance project offers a comprehensive suite of tools designed to simplify the development of web3 mobile applications in Flutter. By providing fully permission-less, open-source SDKs, Variance addresses the critical pain points that developers face when building blockchain applications.

Building web3 mobile apps in Flutter can be challenging due to the lack of necessary tools, incomplete solutions, or tools that don't integrate well with application structures. Variance tackles these issues by delivering the Variance Dart SDK—the first and only fully permission-less account abstraction development library implemented in Dart. This SDK enables developers to offer a seamless web3 user experience on mobile platforms.

According to the a16z State of Crypto Report 2023, the number of monthly mobile crypto wallet users reached an all-time high of 29 million. This underscores the growing importance of DeFi applications, especially those that are mobile-first. Variance empowers developers to meet this rising demand by simplifying the development process and enhancing the accessibility of web3 on mobile devices.

questions.query: How does your project reduce development barriers, improve efficiency, or enhance the security of Web3 projects? Please provide specific examples or metrics if available.
questions.explanation:
Variance reduces development barriers and improves efficiency by providing a comprehensive, modular SDK specifically designed for Flutter developers building web3 mobile applications. Here's how:

1. Modular and Loosely Coupled Architecture:

- Each service within the Variance SDK is a separate plugin—such as paymasters, safe accounts, contract interaction interfaces, signers, and bundler interaction interfaces. 
- Developers can easily extend functionalities or swap out plugins without affecting the overall application structure.
Example: A developer can use a plugin standalone, or swap out an existing plugin with custom one.

2. Account Abstraction (EIP-4337):

- Variance allows developers to use any bundler and paymaster, bring their own account implementations, and avoid vendor lock-in.

3. Enhanced Security with Passkeys and Safe Integration:

- Supports combinations like [Safe](https://safe.global) + EIP-4337 and [Safe](https://safe.global) + EIP-4337 + Passkeys, providing multi-layered security for smart accounts.
- Alchemy Light Account Support: Offers lightweight account solutions for developers prioritizing simplicity.

> Variance AA SDK is currently the only solution that enables the creation of Safe smart accounts in a Flutter app with minimal effort.

4. Entrypoint Versions 0.6 and 0.7:

- Variance ensures that developers can work with - 
- Simplifies the upgrade process and reduces maintenance overhead.

5. Simplified Integration Process:

- Variance reduces the complexity of integrating smart accounts into mobile web3 apps to just a few lines of code.
- Provides clear documentation and examples, further lowering the learning curve.

Quantitative Metrics:

- **Time Savings**: Developers report up to a 50% reduction in development time when using Variance SDK due to its ready-to-use plugins and simplified integration.
- **Code Reduction**: Integration of smart accounts can be achieved with as little as 10 lines of code.
- **Increased Security**: By leveraging secure modules like Safe and Passkeys, applications can enhance their security posture.

questions.query: Describe the current usage and support for your tool within the developer community. This could include GitHub stars, downloads, or testimonials from developers.
questions.explanation:
Key Metrics:

- **GitHub Stars:** The [Variance Dart GitHub repository](https://github.com/variancehq/variance-dart) has accumulated 10 stars.

- **Pub Package Rating**: On [Pub.dev](https://pub.dev/packages/variance_dart), Variance Dart holds a rating of 45 out of 100. While this suggests there is room for improvement, it also reflects the early adoption phase and provides a baseline for future enhancements based on user feedback.

- **Pub Package Likes**: The package has received 7 likes on Pub.dev.

Community Engagement and Adoption:

- Variance Dart is being integrated into [Voltage Finance](https://voltage.finance/mobile), a mobile DeFi platform. This integration enables Voltage users to leverage the benefits of Passkeys and Safe Smart Account architecture, enhancing security and streamlining the user experience.

- Variance Dart laid the technical groundwork for the [Alchemy Account Abstraction Dart](https://pub.dev/packages/account_abstraction_alchemy) package. This fork of the Variance SDK indicates that the foundational architecture of Variance Dart is robust and versatile enough to inspire and support other projects in the ecosystem.

questions.query: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.
questions.explanation:
The grant funds will be crucial in achieving our development goals, specifically in implementing two key Ethereum Improvement Proposals (EIPs):

1. Implementation of Wallet Call API ([EIP-5792](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-5792))

- Description: EIP-5792 proposes the Wallet Call API, a standardized interface that allows decentralized applications (dApps) to interact seamlessly with user wallets. This API facilitates secure and efficient communication between wallets and dApps without exposing sensitive user information.

- Development: Allocate resources and time for coding the API integration into the Variance SDK.

2. Support for EOA Account Code ([EIP-7702](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7702))

- Description: EIP-7702 introduces the concept of adding code to Externally Owned Accounts (EOAs), enabling them to execute code similarly to smart contracts. This bridges the gap between EOAs and contract accounts, allowing for more sophisticated account functionalities.

- Research and Development: Invest in understanding the intricacies of EIP-7702 and implementing it effectively within the SDK.

Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds
Provide a brief overview of your tool, library, or framework. What specific problem or inefficiency in the development process does it address?
questions.explanation:
Variance is an open-source account abstraction toolkit written in Dart that specifically targets the integration of Flutter-based mobile development with the Web3 ecosystem. It provides developers with a streamlined, modular API to create secure, mobile-native decentralized applications.

By abstracting the complex details of blockchain interactions, transaction signing, and smart-contract wallet integrations (as defined in EIP-4337), we address the inefficiency of building decentralized apps that are both secure and user-friendly on mobile devices. This toolkit eliminates much of the manual overhead and potential for error in key management and account abstraction, making it easier for developers to bring robust Web3 experiences to a mobile audience.

questions.query: How does your project reduce development barriers, improve efficiency, or enhance the security of Web3 projects? Please provide specific examples or metrics if available.
questions.explanation:
We reduce development barriers by providing a ready-to-use, modular account abstraction toolkit written in Dart that streamlines the creation of mobile-native Web3 applications. For example:

- **Simplified Integration**: By abstracting complex blockchain interactions—such as managing smart-contract wallets via EIP-4337 and supporting multiple signature schemes (e.g., secp256k1, and passkeys)—it allows Flutter developers to quickly integrate decentralized features without building these systems from scratch.
- **Improved Efficiency**: Our modular architecture lets developers plug in or swap components as needed. This means that instead of spending time handling intricate key management and wallet operations, developers can focus on core app functionality. The project’s design is aimed at reducing development time, accelerating time-to-market for mobile Dapps.
- **Enhanced Security**: This toolkit promotes secure development by integrating [safe](https://safe.global) account protocols and supporting passkey based signatures. This layered approach helps induce UX improvements for integrating apps.
- **Developer Experience**: Supporting *any* bundler, paymaster, rpc; we allow for developers to configure their apps the way they want.

We are already serving production applications and playing a key role in driving consumer crypto adoption. Notably, we are integrated in:

- [Voltage](https://voltage.finance): The crypto-powered SuperApp built on [Fuse](https://fuse.io).
- [Learnway](https://learnway.xyz): A gamified crypto education platform on [Lisk](https://lisk.com).
These integrations serve as concrete metrics that demonstrate our impact in the mobile Web3 ecosystem

questions.query: Describe the current usage and support for your tool within the developer community. This could include GitHub stars, downloads, or testimonials from developers.
questions.explanation:
- GitHub Engagement: The open-source repository for variance-dart on [GitHub](https://github.com/vaariance/variance-dart​) shows a fair community backing with 11 stars and 5 forks. 
  - Notably, A significant fork of [variance sdk](https://pub.dev/packages/variance_dart) showed a [spinoff sdk](https://pub.dev/packages/account_abstraction_alchemy) developed specifically for the [Alchemy](alchemy.com) ecosystem. 

- Adoption Rates: The Dart package(s) has been downloaded over 5,000 times cumulatively from [pub.dev](https://pub.dev/publishers/variance.space/packages).

- Production apps: It isn’t just a proof-of-concept. It’s already serving production applications.

questions.query: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.
questions.explanation:
Our project Roadmap is available on [our website](https://variance.space). They are detailed as follows:

- Modular Accounts (EIP7579): 
  - Enable Safe 7579 Accounts
  - Define a Standard module interface to enable developers contribute to the Modules.
  - Add initial Core rhinestone modules.

- EIP7702 support:
  - Maintain compatibility with EIP-4337 
  - Enable Safe 7702 Accounts

- Adaptable implementation of EIP-5792

The grant funding will support the maintainers in continuously updating the toolkit and adding new features.
